meanings.definition: A church officer or employee responsible for the maintenance of church property.
meanings.sent1: The sexton unlocked the church doors every morning.
meanings.sent2: The sexton takes care of the church garden and building.
meanings.sent3: The sexton joked that his favorite tool was the lawnmower.
meanings.sent4: The sexton's dedication to the church was as solid as the stone walls he maintained.
meanings.sent5: Every Sunday, the sexton could be seen diligently working around the church grounds.

meanings.definition: A person who digs graves and cares for a cemetery.
meanings.sent1: The sexton carefully placed each headstone in the cemetery.
meanings.sent2: Visitors often see the sexton tending to the graves with care.
meanings.sent3: The sexton chuckled as he recounted a funny incident from his graveyard shift.
meanings.sent4: The sexton's presence in the cemetery was a comforting sight for the mourners.
meanings.sent5: In the moonlight, the sexton's silhouette moved gracefully among the tombstones.

meanings.definition: To serve as a sexton in a church.
meanings.sent1: She decided to sexton for the church to give back to the community.
meanings.sent2: He will sexton at the church next Sunday for the first time.
meanings.sent3: The family was surprised when Grandpa announced he wanted to sexton at the church.
meanings.sent4: Her passion to sexton for the church grew stronger with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The church members were grateful for her willingness to sexton and help out.
